thread.title: Anthony Mounier Forced To Quit Saint Etienne After Fans Drive Him Out
thread.title_full: Anthony Mounier Forced To Quit Saint Etienne After Fans Drive Him Out

title: Anthony Mounier Forced To Quit Saint Etienne After Fans Drive Him Out
text:
Anthony Mounier Forced To Quit Saint Etienne After Fans Drive Him Out Mon Feb 06 2017 22:04:18 GMT+0000 (GMT) Mon Feb 06 2017 22:04:18 GMT+0000 (GMT) Nasir Jabbar Nasir Jabbar in football 
It's fair to say Saint-Etienne and Lyon don't get along very well to the extent that players are forced out as a result of a past at Lyon. 
The player by the name of Anthony Mounier enjoyed two seasons with Lyon in 2007 before moving onto Nice. But his ties aren't forgotten. 
The Frenchman left his native land to join the Serie A before returning to Ligue 1 with Saint-Etienne, or well he thought so. 
During the January transfer window, 'The Greens' agreed to snap up the midfielder in order to bolster their attacking options. 
Though he left the club just FOUR days after arriving following the discontent shown by the Saint-Etienne faithfuls. Signed on loan on Friday, Anthony Mounier to quit Saint Etienne already after being deemed public enemy no.1 pic.twitter.com/mhjWMUKlPe - Mohammed Ali (@mohammedali_93) January 30, 2017 
The clubs supporter groups, 'The Green angles', issued a defiant message once he completed his move. 
Banners were unfolded at the clubs training center which read; "Mounier, our colours will never be yours ." 
The manager Christophe Galtier weighed in on the controversial transfer by saying; 
"The situation in regards with Anthony Mounier is not a pleasant one for anyone involved. It was the right decision. Sometimes one does not need to be ashamed to take a backward step." 
The 29-year-old is set to remain in Italy after all - linking up with Atalanta on loan. 
Crazy! Can you recall anything similar? Let us know in the comments section below.
